track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
Start 2016 with the 4th edition of HourRank! It's a one-hour rated contest with 3-4 algorithmic challenges. Are you fast and accurate enough to win it?
The challenges of this round are prepared by Aleksa Plavsic and Shafaet.
primary_contest.name: HourRank 4

model.name: New Year Chaos
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
function minimumBribes($q) {
    // Complete this function
}

fscanf($handle, "%i",$t);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $t; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle, "%i",$n);
    $q_temp = fgets($handle);
    $q = explode(" ",$q_temp);
    $q = array_map('intval', $q);
    minimumBribes($q);
}

?>
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

def minimumBribes(q)
    # Complete this function
end

t = gets.strip.to_i
for a0 in (0..t-1)
    n = gets.strip.to_i
    q = gets.strip
    q = q.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
    minimumBribes(q)
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    t_temp <- getLine
    let t = read t_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..t] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n = read n_temp :: Int
        q_temp <- getLine
        let q = map read $ words q_temp :: [Int]

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Determine how many bribes took place to get a queue into its current state.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
    let [
      t_t (read-line) 
      t (Integer/parseInt t_t) 
    ]

  (
    loop [a0 t]
    (when (> a0 0)

      (
        let [
          n_t (read-line) 
          n (Integer/parseInt n_t) 
        ]
      )

      (
        let [
          q_temp (read-line) 
          q_t (split q_temp #"\s+") 
          q (map #(Integer/parseInt %) q_t) 
        ]
      )

    (recur (- a0 1) ) )
  )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [T]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    T_list = lists:seq(1,T),
    lists:foreach( fun(T0) ->
            { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
            Q = read_array(N,"~d")
    end,T_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
function minimumBribes(q)
    -- Complete this function

t = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < t do
    n = io.read("*number", "*l")
    q = {}
    q_temp = io.read()
    q_i = 1
    for token in string.gmatch(q_temp, "[^%s]+") do
    	q[q_i] = token
    	q_i = q_i + 1
    end
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
